result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Modifying conditions of Release. 1.) defendant is allowed to go to 408 Wolfcreek Circle; Roberts, WI 54023 2.) All other conditions remain in full force and effect.  Signed by SRN on 11/2/22. arc   c: DE   e: DA and Atty

to modify bond. Filed by Atty Kowitz. arc   to rg

2:35 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Nathan Adrian Pedersen in court.  Attorney Travis W Kowitz in court for Nathan Adrian Pedersen. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. S/T of Chief Jerry Strohbusch of Village of Roberts. Direct by ADA Ballo. Cross by Atty Kowitz. Redirect by ADA Ballo. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court directs State to provide discovery to the defense as soon as possible. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 3:02 PM. bph
Arraignment scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Arraignment on November 9, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

11:13 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis W Kowitz appeared by video for Nathan Adrian Pedersen. Defendant Nathan Adrian Pedersen in court. Court reviews case. ADA Rockow states discovery was provided and an offer was sent. Atty Kowtiz received discovery and offer and has spoke with DE re: offer. DE objected to offer. Court sets PH. Court confirms  phone number.  DE updates address Adjourned 11:22 Am

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations Sharna P. EXCEPT by text message regarding children only.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from residence in presence of law enforcement only.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:49 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nathan Adrian Pedersen in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Nathan Adrian Pedersen for today. DE doesn't qualify for PD. DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument; bond ordered. DE intends to hire his own atty. Court advises DE of right to speedy preliminary hearing. DE waives speedy prelim. Court sets Preliminary Hearing. Adjourned at 1:5 PM.  gll
